fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports

Interface DataOutboundPortI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentServiceI, DataRequiredI.PullI, DataRequiredI.PushI, OfferedI, OutboundPortI, PortI, java.rmi.Remote, RequiredI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataOutboundPort, AbstractDataOutboundPortForPlugin, PairDataOutboundPort, PingPongDataOutboundPort

    public interface DataOutboundPortI
extends OutboundPortI, DataRequiredI.PullI, DataRequiredI.PushI
    The interface DataOutboundPortI represents the category of ports used by components exchanging data rather than calling providers for their services.

    Description

    An outbound port is associated with a BasicDataRequiredI interface used to implement a basic interface to get data from a provider component. The primary way to get the data is the pull mode, where the client component calls the provider through the request() method which returns a piece of data. But the port can also be used in a push mode where the provider delivers the data to the client by calling a receive method with a piece of data as parameter.

    Created on : 2011-11-07

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Class<?> getImplementedPullInterface()
      get the pull interface implemented by this port.
      java.lang.Class<?> getImplementedPushInterface()
      get the push interface implemented by this port.
      java.lang.Object getServiceProviderReference()
      return the reference to the Java object that is implementing the services called through the data outbound port and its push interface; usually, it is an object implementing the owner component (i.e., implementing the interface ComponentI and inheriting from AbstractComponent), but it can also be a plug-in instance held by the owner component.
